intro: Placus indicus, commonly known as the Indian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. It thrives in dry, arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in gardens.
